page.title: Nominal Phrase - QP Modifiers Part 2
page.introduction: Like the earlier modifiers, it may be the case that quantifier phrases in your language come before, after, or on either side of the noun.

radioGroup.prompt: Where do quantifier phrases (including numbers) occur with respect to the noun?
Can all the quantifier phrases appear on either side of the nominal phrase?
radioGroup.radio: No, there are separate sets for each side

radioGroup.prompt: Can quantifier phrases appear on both sides in the same nominal phrase?
radioGroup.radio: No, only on one side or the other
Yes, and when quantifiers phrases are present, they must appear on both sides
Yes, they may appear on both sides, but only the one in initial position is required

radioGroup.prompt: May a quantifier phrase also occur only after the noun?

radioGroup.radio: Yes, they may appear on both sides, but only the one in final position is required

radioGroup.prompt: May a quantifier phrase also occur only after the noun?

form.instruction: In the lexicon, mark those quantifiers or numbers which can only occur before the noun with the feature DP-initial and those which can only occur after the noun with the feature DP-final. [Note: if all numbers can only go on one side or the other, rather than entering the feature on every entry in the lexicon, add [DP-initial] or [DP-final] as appropriate to the Num template using the Feature Template Editor.] Do not enter either feature on any quantifier or number which can occur on either side.
